body.p: The Basic Contractor Board has these connections ():

li.p: Remote EPO: Dry contact connection point for input of an REPO signal. Connect external dry contacts to terminals marked +24V EPO RET. The REPO signal is sent to the PDU Board via the REMOTE EPO connection, which is not a customer connection point. Connection of voltage to Remote EPO Connection can cause damage to the unit.
Four (4) Building Alarms. Alarm names can be specified by Eaton in PDU Board setup.
Four (4) remote relays that output dry contact (NO) signals. (Note: Remote relays can accept dry contacts rated up to 2A/250V.)

Relays are programmable using the USB setup connection on the PDU M4G Board. Eaton PDI programs the relay inputs in manufacturing. So, for example, a relay can be programmed to turn on when a specific Building Alarm, such as a fire alarm, is received. The building information management system (BIS) or other control system receives the signal and can cause PDU shutdown with an REPO signal.
By default, the first, left-most relay is programmed to close when the PDU Summary Alarm, PDU Board points list, Modbus Register 70, is in alarm.

body.p: Modbus RTU Connections: The board has customer connections (J3, J4) for upstream and downstream 4-wire Modbus RTU (). (To set 2-wire Modbus upstream to customer DCIM or BIM systems, set jumpers on the Color Monitor backpanel at W1 and W2. See section Customer Network Connections and .)
